alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 11 at 8:56PM AKST until December 12 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, except along the Richardson Highway south of the Edgerton Cutoff, where an additional 12 to 20 inches is expected. * WHERE...Copper River Basin. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This warning has been expanded to include the remainder of the Richardson Highway to Paxson, as well as the Tok Cutoff to Slana. Southerly Copper Valley winds have resulted in heavy rain along the lower elevations of the Edgerton Highway and McCarthy Road. Mixed precipitation and rain below approximately 1400 ft will slowly transition back to snow near Chitina by Tuesday morning. Refreezing of wet roadways will produce hazardous travel conditions.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
